attributes.action: Stop the relocation of unauthorized immigrants arriving in the UK to Rwanda
attributes.additional_details: Under proposals, individuals will be assessed and decisions made based on the "strength" of asylum claims - however, details on the assessment and criteria used are sparse. The United Nations refugee agency warned that the shifting of responsibility by the UK for claimants of refugee status could be a breach of international law. Amnesty International also raised concerns regarding human rights issues present in Rwanda relating to the right to a fair trial, freedom of expression and privacy.
attributes.background: The UK government is proposing a scheme that will see "tens of thousands" of unauthorized adult immigrants arriving in the UK of the coming years relocated to Rwanda.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Stop the government's 'one way ticket' plan to send asylum seekers to Rwanda
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614913
